How to Create a Facebook Icon Using Photoshop: 14 Steps

 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Create a Facebook Icon Using Photoshop   
 Creating a Facebook icon shouldn't be as complicated as you think it should be. How simple it is as it appears should also be as simple as it is to do. In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a Facebook icon the simplest way using Photoshop. 
 Steps Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1e\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1e\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open a new document.  You can choose any settings as preferred. Press OK when everything is set. Set the document to the following values:
 Size: 500 x 500 
 Resolution: 72 pixels/inch 
 Color Mode: RGB Color at 8 bit 
 Background Contents: Transparent 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 On Tool options, select Rounded Rectangle Tool. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Drag mouse on the editor pad to create a rounded rectangle image. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Apply a blue gradient overlay to the image.  Set all the values and press OK once done.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Create a new layer.  Press Ctrl + Shift + N. Name it (e.g. “Button Gloss”) and click OK.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Create an ellipse over the top of the image.  Grab the Elliptical Marquee Tool. Set white as your foreground color.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/18\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/18\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Open the Gradient Editor.  Select the the Foreground to Transparent gradient. Drag the gradient from bottom to the top.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a6\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a6\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Clean up the excess gradient around the edges of the image by pressing Alt + Left Click between the Button Gloss layer and the Button Layer. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7b\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-9-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7b\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-9-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Set the Opacity of the Button Gloss.  You can set it to 20% or to whatever you feel looks better.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b9\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-10-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b9\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-10-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 Select Elliptical Marquee Tool again and set properties.  Draw like bellow and change layer opacity to 30%.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-11.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-11.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-11.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-11.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 11 
 Select Elliptical Marquee Tool one more time.  Create a rectangular shape just at the bottom part of the image. Set the properties into the following values:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-12-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-12-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 12 
 Click on the Text Tool.  Set the values into Arial Bold for the Font Style and 300 sharp for the Font Size.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c9\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-13-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c9\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-13-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 13 
 Type letter “f”.  Position it at the middle of the right side.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-14-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-a-Facebook-Icon-Using-Photoshop-Step-14-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 14 
 Your final Facebook icon should look like this.
